intro: Malcolmia lacera subsp. broussonetii, commonly known as the Persian wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant is herbaceous, with erect stems and bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant color and ability to attract pollinators.
